title: 115_hr1075
content: The Act may be cited as the "Freedom for Refugees Escaping Enmity (FREE) Act" and nullifies the effect of an executive order. The "Protecting the Nation from Foreign Terrorist Entry into the United States" Executive Order is null and void, with no force or effect. No funds can be used to implement the policy changes outlined in the Executive Order, and aliens in custody under the order must be released. Security will release any alien in custody under the Executive Order, and revoked visas will be reinstated unless the alien is ineligible. The Secretary of State will ensure timely renewal or replacement of visas for aliens affected by the Executive Order. The Secretary of State will ensure that any decision to refuse a visa under the Executive Order is reconsidered to determine the alien's eligibility under immigration laws. The Executive Order and actions taken under it will not affect immigration status or eligibility for benefits under immigration laws. Certain sections of the Immigration and Nationality Act will not apply to denials of admission, removal, or departure under the Executive Order. The Executive Order will not impact an alien's application for admission or voluntary departure from the United States. Alien registration cannot be terminated if an immigrant visa application is delayed due to the Executive Order. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to prohibit discrimination in the issuance of immigrant visas based on religion or lack of religious beliefs. Additionally, a new section is added to prohibit denying admission or entry based on religion. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to prohibit discrimination in immigrant visa issuance based on religion or lack of beliefs. A new section prohibits denying entry to the US based on religion. Section 212(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to restrict the President's authority to modify immigration laws for certain aliens with valid visas or status. The President's authority to modify immigration laws for certain aliens with valid visas or status is restricted under section 212(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act. This includes aliens admitted under section 207(c)(1) or granted asylum, with no impact on authorities under subsections (h) and (i) of section 221.
